alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 26 at 1:21PM MST until November 29 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches, except 6 to 15 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...The eastern and southeastern highlands of Idaho from the Montana border to just north of the Bear Lake Basin. This includes the towns of Island Park, Ashton, Tetonia, Driggs, Victor, Swan Valley, and Wayan. * WHEN...From Sunday late morning through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The combination of wind in excess of 15 mph and snowfall can mean heavy drifting of the new snow and a sudden change to near zero visibility for motorists. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
